intro: Machaerina raiateensis, commonly known as the Tahitian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Society Islands in French Polynesia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and is often found growing along coastal areas and in moist, shaded environments. It is valued for its ornamental beauty and is also used in traditional Polynesian medicine for its purported healing properties.
